group_1.narration: <June of 31 BCE…>
<In the palace of Cleopatra,@queen of the Ptolemaic Dynasty…>
<Late night…>
―Ebony―@(My life is yours…)
―Ebony―@(My fate is yours…)
―Ebony―@(Everything is in your hands…)
―Ebony―@...
―Ebony―@...I was taught never to forget that.
―Ebony―@Back then…
I was born of the Met Clan.
I never knew my parents…@I've been told that they were killed by bandits@for as long as I remember.
Though I was an orphan,@I never felt lonely,
for our clan had many children@in my exact position.
Children like me were brought together@and raised collectively by the clan.
What with the environment I grew up in,@my upbringing never felt unusual.
In retrospect, however, perhaps my parents@had lost their lives in the process of carrying out@some sort of duty for our clan.
…But as a little girl, I never imagined that,@not even slightly.
In any case, my clan and its routines@comprise my whole world.@It's all I've ever known.

group_1.textRight: The Met Clan is steadfast in our devotion@to the royal family.
In recognition for our many years of loyalty,
we were allowed to make this place our@stronghold… The Met Clan's sacred grounds.
Therefore, we must always respect and@submit to the royal family.
We must NEVER forget that we only exist@because of them.

group_1.narration: The royal family is everything.
This is the core tenet of the Met Clan.@It is drilled into our very beings@day in and day out.
Once that creed was planted into@my innocent heart, awe and reverence for@the royal family quickly sprouted@and took deep root.
…Eventually, there came the day@that one of the elders called upon me.

group_1.textRight: Today…I am asking for something that@only you alone can do.
